resources.string:
This is a new feature!
 You don't need to watch the screen to pilot the drone any more.
 In fact the Cursor is redrawed and centered where you put the finger into screen.
 In this way the drone does't move at the first touch, it starts moving only
 if you move your fingher on the screen.
 The standard cursors are fixed, so you need to watch the screen to point
 the fingher toward the center to avoid moving drone.
 Try it!
 You can drive the drone without to watch the screen now.
 If your fingher is to much closed to the bounds of screen then
 a vibration will give you a feedback.

This is a new feature!
 You can swap x, y, z axis of analog pilot cursors.
 (x = left/right, y = altitude, z = frontward/backward)
 In this way you can use right cursor to obtain death loop
 and left cursor to generate arcs.
 It is a new way to pilot drone.
 Some input can't be executed because are out of range
 of propoller motors possibilities.
 Try it!
You can scale the speed of propoller motors, so you can reduce\n the speed for a smooth driving
The led shows you the percentage of battery level. 4.2V is 100%
The led shows you the power level of BLE drone connection in db.

The Offset left/right button allows to swap analogic/digital cursor.
 Pressing the same button the cursors types are swapped.
 If offeset is pressed, then digital cursors changes the offset Yaw,
 pitch and roll and altitude by 1/128 of their max value for each click.

Third Action before starts
 The Take_off button is for taking off the drone.
 During this phase is necessary to use altitude cursor to stop the drone.
 When drone flies, the same button become a Land for landing.

Second Action before starts
 The first Button is for sensor calibration, so drone Gyroscpe sensor starts 
 from correct value, because the drone board could be a bit not horizontal 
 The Take_off button requires 1 sec pressed to be active. 
 If button is pressed for at least 1 sec, then button becomes
 green for 2 sec else red for 2 sec. 
 Use it before to take off.
 The second button is for Arming the propoller motors.
 When drone flies, the same button become a stop propoller motors.
 Stop button is the last possible action to stop drone
 when you don't have any more the drone control.
 The third item is the led to know Arming status
 (green is armed, red is not armed).

First Action before starts
 Connection Button allows to connect the drone by BLE.
 After pressing, the page becomes the connection page
 to search and select your drone into the list.
 Click on your drone to allow connection and the page return the home one.
 The button changes color in order to the status connection:
 				Blue light is for starting connection phase.
 				green means connected.
 				Yellow means searching connection.
 				Red means no connection.

The first selector is for enabling drone sensor data: 
 				Accelerometer
 				Gyroscope
 				Magnetometer
 				Pressure
 				Altitude
 Instead of -STDrone software version- will be visualized
 these sensor data with their measure unit.
 The second selector is for Enable or disable Logging File
 with timestamp of drone sensor data.
 Pay Attention!!!
 the name of files are always different,
 so you remeber to delete manually useless file
 The directory is into main root of sdcard:
 /STMicroelectronics/logs
The selector is for enable or disable Yaw (activation suggested for beginners)\n

The selector is for changing square or circle shape cursor.
 The Square is optimum to have the right corrispondence with drone dynamic.
 In fact the maximum speed is on the corner of square.
 Before moving, you can rotate to 45degree into right direction by using Yaw.
 Then you try the maximum speed moving fingher on the corner of square.

Sensitivity button is for moving into Sensitivity page
 to set Sensitivity Analog Cursor
 The speed moving of finghers are usually proportionally
 to the speed rotation request for propoller motors
 The Sensitivity page allows to introduce a non linear behaviour.
 In particular is possible to increase the speed slope rate
 when you touch cursor for the first time.
 If you increase start slope rate then you also decrease the it
 when you are closed to the cursor bounds.

The seek bar changes the start slope rate of sensitivity
 when you press cursor for first touch.
 The selector are for Yaw, Pitch/Roll and Altitude.
 The value can change since 1 to Max value.
 1 means non linear disable, so speed rotation request
 is proportional to speed finghers
 x value means x times higher than proportional speed only for first touch
 If you increase start slope rate then you also decrease the it
 when you are closed to the cursor bounds.

The selector is for change seek bar scope
 If -Start slope rate Max- is selected the Max range can change by seek bar
 There is a mininum value possible not changeble
 Changing Max changes, except for non linear disable, also start slope rate
 change and its value is also visualised
